definition: the few are no match for the many/heavily outnumbered/facing impossible odds (idiom)
few/scant/widowed
(negative prefix)/not/no
enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand
abbr. for 眾議院|众议院[Zhong4 yi4 yuan4], House of Representatives
many/numerous/crowd/multitude
variant of 眾|众[zhong4]

sentences.english: Before the Indians realized what was happening, they were outnumbered.
sentences.chinese: 当印第安人意识到发生了什么，他们已经寡不敌众了。

sentences.english: Even without those two Death Eaters, Harry is still outnumbered.
sentences.chinese: 即便没有那两个食死徒，哈利仍然寡不敌众。

sentences.english: After a fierce battle, outnumbered army of peasants, most captured.
sentences.chinese: 一场激战后，农民军寡不敌众，多数被俘。

sentences.english: The Thai workmen were hopelessly outnumbered.
The girl was brave enough, but as being outnumbered, she wasfinally knocked into the middle of next week by thegang.
sentences.chinese: 她很勇敢，但终因寡不敌众，被那帮人打晕过去。

sentences.english: Two people in the navy general affairs department is seriously injured, outnumbered.
sentences.chinese: 二人在海军总务部皆身受重伤，寡不敌众。

sentences.english: "White little" and I are losing the fight.
The stone be outnumbered by a group of Japanese control.
sentences.chinese: 石头寡不敌众被一伙日本人控制住。

sentences.english: The defenders were outnumbered and had to give in.
sentences.chinese: 那些抵抗者寡不敌众，只得投降。

definition: the multitude against the few, a wide disparity (idiom from Mencius); heavily outnumbered/unequally matched/overwhelmed by weight of numbers
multitude of enemies, few friends (idiom from Mencius)/heavily outnumbered/beaten by the weight of numbers
to fight with all one's might
to retreat in defeat
to go all out for sth at risk of one's life
to besiege/to beleaguer/to attack from all sides/to jointly speak or write against sb
seriously injured
many men, a great force (idiom); many hands provide great strength/There is safety in numbers.
casualties/dead and injured
out of ammunition and no hope of reinforcements (idiom); in desperate straits
to beat back/to repel/to repulse
to be defeated on the battlefield/to be beaten in a contest
to flee in disorder/defeated and in rout
to retreat again and again in defeat/to suffer defeat after defeat
to defeat/to inflict a defeat on sb
to vow to fight to the death
